CatDescriptText: Cutline of related images published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 19, 1958, page A2, read: "Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 19, 1958, page A2, reads: "Democrats Pour It On at Jefferson Day Dinner - Some 2,000 loyal Democrats jammed the 17th floor ballroom and several surrounding rooms of the Hotel Penn-Sheraton, Monday evening, at the annual Jefferson Day dinner and heard "party brass" of the regular State Democratic Organization, headed by Gov. George M. Leader, candidate for the U.S. Senate, and Mayor David L. Lawrence, who is running for Governor of Pennsylvania, exchange compliments. Ms. Leader rocked the ballroom when he said: "Mayor Lawrence is the best qualified man ever to run for Governor." And the Mayor rocked 'em right back with the promise: "And with your help I know we can achieve great victory. I KNOW that I am going to win." Left to right: Toastmaster and chairman, Thomas E. Barrett, clerk of courts, Allegheny County; Mayor Lawrence, inspecting the 466-page program, which brought in almost $50,000 in ads for the party's campaign chest; the Hon. John Morgan David, Judge of Common Pleas Court, Philadelphia, and candidate for Lieutenant Governor, and State Senator John M. Barr, State Democratic chairman. Right: Fifth Ward Chairman Robert E. (Pappy) Williams, magistrate, chats with some of the party faithful from his district. Left to right: Hubert Smith, field auditor, State Auditor General's office; Curtis (Chocolate) Williams, committeeman, Sixth District; Assistant District Attorney K. Leroy Irvis, candidate for the State Legislature, First Legislative District; Mr. Williams, Ralph (Buzzy) Gloster, committeeman, First District; Louis Mason, deputy director, Human Relations Commission City of Pittsburgh, and Albert (Bobby) Dukes, active in political circles in the 12th District. The hand between Mason and Dukes is that of Atty. Byrd Brown, who is seated between the former pair. Also present, but not shown in the picture, was Jacob (Jake) Williams, committeeman, 11th District. - Harris Photo." and ""Local 609 Present, as Usual - Always well-represented at the Annual Jefferson Day dinner is Refuse and Salvage Drivers and Helpers Union, Local 609, International Brotherhood of Teamsters, AFL-CIO, and this year was no exception. Left to right, clockwise: William Miller, state workingman's compensation referee; Ted Finch, Anthony Rice, John Finch, Theodore (Ted) Johnson, Andrew Goodson, Theodore (Ted) Brown, Howard Lyons and Steadman Buckley. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Robert E. "Pappy" Williams, standing with man wearing a diagonally striped necktie, among men and women seated at banquet tables for Jefferson Day Dinner in Penn Sheraton Hotel, Downtown
